Package edu.depauw.csc232.solitaire.klondike

This package contains the game-specific classes for single-card-draw Klondike solitaire.
  • KlondikeGame is an implementation of the Game interface, which is the primary external interface for creating a new game of Klondike. It collects the various Piles that make up the user interface of a game of Klondike. The Stock is the draw pile; cards are drawn one at a time and put onto the Waste pile; when the stock is empty, the waste is turned over and used to replenish the stock. There are seven Tableau piles that initially have one face-up card on top of zero or more face-down cards. Cards may be played from the waste onto the tableau in alternating suit and descending rank (King through Ace). Packets of face-up cards may be moved between the tableau piles as long as the alternating suits and descending ranks are respected. When all of the face-up cards are moved from a tableau pile, the next face-down card (if any) is turned over. A Packet whose bottom card is a King may be placed on an empty tableau. There are four Foundation piles, which are initially empty. Cards may be built on a foundation pile in increasing rank order, starting with an Ace, as long as all of the cards in a pile have the same suit. The game ends when all 52 cards are moved to the foundations.
  • StockStrategy, WasteStrategy, TableauStrategy, and FoundationStrategy are classes that encode the above rules for clicking, dragging, and dropping from and to the various types of piles.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    FoundationStrategy
    This PileStrategy encapsulates the rules for a foundation pile in Klondike.
    KlondikeGame
    An implementation of the single-card-draw version of Klondike solitaire.
    StockStrategy
    This PileStrategy encapsulates the rules for the stock pile in Klondike.
    TableauStrategy
    This PileStrategy encapsulates the rules for a tableau pile in Klondike.
    WasteStrategy
    This PileStrategy encapsulates the rules for the waste pile in Klondike.
